intro: Melampyrum henryanum, commonly known as yellow lousewort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic growth habit. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense spikes, often appearing in late spring to early summer. The species is known for its distinctive, glandular hairs and its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
